Posts.Content: Oct 12, 2012 12:12AM SASSY45 wrote: Cindy, i wish you the best of luck. Here are a few things that came in handy to have. Baby washclothes-you can not lift your arms at all and these are very soft a thin for cleaning underarms. Bed wedge, definatly the camis were helpful, a shower wand so you dont get to wet, Contact a company called Edgepark medical supply. Your insurance should pay for this. 1. Silk tape, this is softer on skin when peeling it off 2.6x6 square guaze and long rolld about 4"wide 3. 1pound tub of bicitracin. 4. Gloves for changing bandage 5. Adheasive remover packs Clothes you can zip up
Posts.Title: this is an after surgery question anamerty gumshoe
